intro: Rubus rigidus var. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén raspberry, is a shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and thorny stems, typical of the Rubus genus. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small, bright red drupes that are often edible. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have serrated margins, while its flowers are typically pink or white. This species is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
